_header: All is but a phantom that we with fare
Subjects: transitoriness of world; vanity, against worldly
_description: On the Transitoriness of the World — 94 lines in monorhyming stanzas of varying lengths

BlCottGalEIX.First Lines:
Al es bot a fantum þat with ffarevs be houes ilkaday heuen
                    make nyȝareforto wend fra þis werld naked & barebot ur
                    wendyng clathe with outen any gare…
BlCottGalEIX.Last Lines:
…ȝit sais Ihesu merci als he saide areAl es bot a fantom
                    þat we obout fare
BlCottGalEIX.Editions:
Hall,  Joseph. 
             “Short Pieces from MS Cotton Galba E.ix.” 
             Englische Studien
         21 (1895): 201-9: 201-4.
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 2.457-8.
